Title: The Performance of Spin Lock Alternatives for Shared-Memory Multiprocessors
AuthorList: Thomas E. Anderson. IEEE TPDS Volume 1:1, January 1990.
Description: A classic paper on how different locking alternatives do and don’t scale. By Tom Anderson, very well known researcher in both systems and networking. And author of a very ﬁne OS textbook, we must say.

Title: An Analysis of Linux Scalability to Many Cores Abstract
AuthorList: Silas Boyd-Wickizer, Austin T. Clements, Yandong Mao, Aleksey Pesterev, M. Frans Kaashoek, Robert Morris, Nickolai Zeldovich. OSDI ’10, Vancouver, Canada, October 2010.
Description: A terriﬁc modern paper on the difﬁculties of scaling Linux to many cores.

Title: Parallel Computer Architecture: A Hardware/Software Approach
AuthorList: David E. Culler, Jaswinder Pal Singh, and Anoop Gupta. Morgan Kaufmann, 1999.
Description: A treasure ﬁlled with details about parallel machines and algorithms. As Mark Hill humorously observes on the jacket, the book contains more information than most research papers.

Title: The Implementation of the Cilk-5 Multithreaded Language
AuthorList: Matteo Frigo, Charles E. Leiserson, Keith Randall. PLDI ’98, Montreal, Canada, June 1998.
Description: Cilk is a lightweight language and runtime for writing parallel programs, and an excellent example of the work-stealing paradigm.

Title: Using Cache Memory To Reduce Processor-Memory Trafﬁc
AuthorList: James R. Goodman. ISCA ’83, Stockholm, Sweden, June 1983.
Description: The pioneering paper on how to use bus snooping, i.e., paying attention to requests you see on the bus, to build a cache coherence protocol. Goodman’s research over many years at Wisconsin is full of cleverness, this being but one example.

Title: Towards Transparent CPU Scheduling
AuthorList: Joseph T. Meehean. Doctoral Dissertation at University of Wisconsin—Madison, 2011.
Description: A dissertation that covers a lot of the details of how modern Linux multiprocessor scheduling works. Pretty awesome! But, as co-advisors of Joe’s, we may be a bit biased here.

Title: A Primer on Memory Consistency and Cache Coherence
AuthorList: Daniel J. Sorin, Mark D. Hill, and David A. Wood. Synthesis Lectures in Computer Architecture. Morgan and Claypool Publishers, May 2011.
Description: A deﬁnitive overview of memory consistency and multiprocessor caching. Required reading for anyone who likes to know way too much about a given topic.

Title: Earliest Eligible Virtual Deadline First: A Flexible and Accurate Mechanism for Proportional Share Resource Allocation
AuthorList: Ion Stoica and Hussein Abdel-Wahab. Technical Report TR-95-22, Old Dominion University, 1996.
Description: A tech report on this cool scheduling idea, from Ion Stoica, now a professor at U.C. Berkeley and world expert in networking, distributed systems, and many other things.

Title: Evaluating the Performance of Cache-Afﬁnity Scheduling in Shared-Memory Multiprocessors
AuthorList: Josep Torrellas, Andrew Tucker, Anoop Gupta. Journal of Parallel and Distributed Computing, Volume 24:2, February 1995.
Description: This is not the ﬁrst paper on the topic, but it has citations to earlier work, and is a more readable and practical paper than some of the earlier queuingbased analysis papers.
